introduction:
Welcome to the Optical Communication Lab, a vital part of the B.Tech curriculum designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of optical fiber communication systems. This lab offers an immersive, web-based simulator that enables you to explore and experiment with key concepts in optical communication, such as signal transmission, fiber optics, modulation, and detection techniques.
Our simulator provides a dynamic and interactive platform where you can perform experiments virtually, eliminating the need for physical lab equipment while delivering real-time data visualization and analysis. This innovative tool allows you to simulate various optical components and systems, offering insights into the practical aspects of optical communication and reinforcing theoretical knowledge. By engaging in this lab, you will gain essential skills to apply in real-world optical communication applications.

experiments.name: Intensity modulation of laser output through an optical fiber
Measurement of data rate for digital optical link
Measurement of losses in plastic fiber

objective: The objective of this lab to understand the structure and applications of optical fiber.
